results.content: I took this course as a refresher.  I plan to use the information to write programs for the classes I am teaching.  I found the course short and sweet.  I don't have a lot of time to listen to courses.  Maybe about 10 or 15 minutes between the different classes I have to teach.    I felt a sense of accomplishment when I complete each course before I have to continue with my day.  I would like to take more courses from this instructor.

results.content: It is a good basic course and perfect for beginners with zero knowledge.  I like learning fast and this course like a shortcut for learning html. However, if you already know something about this topic then you might better to take a more detailed course. Also in the last two part there might be more information and less advertesiment.

results.content: If you're looking to start a web design career or wanting to know how to design pages for yourself, this is an excellent course to have in your tool set.
results.content_html: If you're looking to start a web design career or wanting to know how to design pages for yourself, this is an excellent course to have in your tool set.

results.content: John is easy to understand and really goes through the topics at a comfortable, and more importantly, confident pace. If you're starting out with HTML (or CSS or JavaScript) then definitely consider these courses.
results.content_html: John is easy to understand and really goes through the topics at a comfortable, and more importantly, confident pace. If you're starting out with HTML (or CSS or JavaScript) then definitely consider these courses.

results.content: Great starting point to get the basics down. Don't be afraid to pause the video (he goes FAST to cram it all into one hour) so you can play around with the code a little and get it right. I also STRONGLY SUGGEST you take a second at the end of each lesson and cut n' paste your work into a .txt file to practice on later. Take this stuff and use it in your ebay listings, on a blog or start a freebie website. After you get it down pat, the next step is to move on to his CSS class to REALLY make your html pop like a pro!
results.content_html: Great starting point to get the basics down. Don't be afraid to pause the video (he goes FAST to cram it all into one hour) so you can play around with the code a little and get it right. I also STRONGLY SUGGEST you take a second at the end of each lesson and cut n' paste your work into a .txt file to practice on later. Take this stuff and use it in your ebay listings, on a blog or start a freebie website. After you get it down pat, the next step is to move on to his CSS class to REALLY make your html pop like a pro!

results.content: This course is exactly what it claims; a quick and dirty how-to on learning HTML in roughly an hour. The basics are covered well and the pace of the lectures is just about perfect. I will definitely take more of Mr. Bura's courses.
results.content_html: This course is exactly what it claims; a quick and dirty how-to on learning HTML in roughly an hour. The basics are covered well and the pace of the lectures is just about perfect. I will definitely take more of Mr. Bura's courses.

results.content:
As I have not coded in 15 years, this was an Ok refresher. I should have read the chapter index better, because I missed some essentials, especially the div tag. Therefore the course felt a little incomplete for me, but maybe good for someone who has never written any html ever. 
But I liked, and recommend, the instructor. He explains well, and comes through as someone who actually wants you to learn something. And that is essential.
results.content_html:

results.content: It's true, you can finish this in one hour and know so much more. I wish all training was like this. (Especially in regular school. UDEMY ftw!) The choice of using jsbin.com as the teaching site is great as well. I used the sublime text editor as I'm comfortable with it but jsbin.com is great for those who don't want to waste time using a local app.
results.content_html: It's true, you can finish this in one hour and know so much more. I wish all training was like this. (Especially in regular school. UDEMY ftw!) The choice of using jsbin.com as the teaching site is great as well. I used the sublime text editor as I'm comfortable with it but jsbin.com is great for those who don't want to waste time using a local app.

results.content: John has a nice a voice and his short lectures hit specific points that you can return to later.   He makes the same kind of mistakes we all do with HTML (like forgetting /closing tags and misspelling words) and just fixes them as he goes which makes him relatable.  A few of his lectures could be a bit less chatty, but all in all in one of the better instructors on Udemy.  Would definitely take more of his courses.
results.content_html: John has a nice a voice and his short lectures hit specific points that you can return to later. He makes the same kind of mistakes we all do with HTML (like forgetting /closing tags and misspelling words) and just fixes them as he goes which makes him relatable. A few of his lectures could be a bit less chatty, but all in all in one of the better instructors on Udemy. Would definitely take more of his courses.

results.content: Excellent overview of html, done methodically.  The use of JSBin as a teaching tool is an excellent idea.  My only criticism is that I found that there was a bit of filler monologue, especially at the end when Javascript was discussed; I think that a lecture demonstrating how a web page is put on an external server would have been more appropriate.
results.content_html: Excellent overview of html, done methodically. The use of JSBin as a teaching tool is an excellent idea. My only criticism is that I found that there was a bit of filler monologue, especially at the end when Javascript was discussed; I think that a lecture demonstrating how a web page is put on an external server would have been more appropriate.

results.content: I've tried HTML tutorials before, they've always confused and intimidated me. This course from John Bura was different. John exlpains everything extremely well in ways the beginner can truly understand. If you're interested in HTML, I suggest this course as your starting point.

John exlpains everything extremely well in ways the beginner can truly understand. If you're interested in HTML, I suggest this course as your starting point.

results.content:
This is solid beginner course. I had very little html knowledge before this mini course and now I feel comfortable enough to start experimenting without having to have 15 tabs open to various "learn html sites" while trying to figure out the most basic stuff.

Thanks to John Bura for the easy and concise instruction. This was terrific.

results.content: The course is well done, but it does introduce beginners to improper coding. <i> and <b> are both deprecated tags, the table border is also not a good idea, and inline styling is generally a bad idea. Maybe focus more on decoupling HTML from the CSS for performance and reuse. Get someone to think in terms of clean, reusable code is the best approach to ensuring their success. Thanks, Jeremy

results.content:
This is a great little course for people who are completely new to the developer world.  It covers all the basics efficiently, and is a great intro to code.
There were a couple small points that could have been expanded on a bit more, and some context to other parts might be beneficial, but neither of these points takes away from the course, and I reckon these things were left out in the interest of making the course quick and simple.
I'd recommend this to somebody who's interested in code but hasn't touched code before.
results.content_html:
This is a great little course for people who are completely new to the developer world. It covers all the basics efficiently, and is a great intro to code.
There were a couple small points that could have been expanded on a bit more, and some context to other parts might be beneficial, but neither of these points takes away from the course, and I reckon these things were left out in the interest of making the course quick and simple.
I'd recommend this to somebody who's interested in code but hasn't touched code before.

results.content: I have gone through many courses fr HTML. What I've noticed is, the instructors want to impart all their knowledge (not a bad thing). However, in trying to do so, they end up teaching so many things that if someone is a beginner, they do not realize that HTML is very basic. Once the basic tags are learnt, that's when you should delve deep. It is more like the alphabet, you gotta learn the alphabet, then the words. John helps beginners do EXACTLY THAT. An amazing course. I'll recommend to anybody who cares to listen.
results.content_html: I have gone through many courses fr HTML. What I've noticed is, the instructors want to impart all their knowledge (not a bad thing). However, in trying to do so, they end up teaching so many things that if someone is a beginner, they do not realize that HTML is very basic. Once the basic tags are learnt, that's when you should delve deep. It is more like the alphabet, you gotta learn the alphabet, then the words. John helps beginners do EXACTLY THAT. An amazing course. I'll recommend to anybody who cares to listen.

results.content: I came away from the course feeling more confident about my understanding of HTML. The content is well organized and interesting to learn. I have signed up for many of John Bura's courses. He talks to students WITHOUT a pretentious attitude. I find that appealing.

results.content: I learned so much so fast, I just didn't have an HTML editor ready to practice with, but I'm downloading it now.  I was happy that I knew more than I thought I did.  Definitely need to review the script tags, and try the other 1 hour courses.
results.content_html: I learned so much so fast, I just didn't have an HTML editor ready to practice with, but I'm downloading it now. I was happy that I knew more than I thought I did. Definitely need to review the script tags, and try the other 1 hour courses.

results.content: Not for absolute beginners. If you don't know what a tag or element is, white space and how to nest elements, then you should search for another course. This course is concise and it is good to polish off the basics of HTML and to move to the next level. It uses online coding environment so you can practise. The audio and video are pretty good apart from the last two lectures where there are some audio problems for a few seconds. Unfortunately, I saw quite a few unanswered questions, posted a long time ago, that is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. Overall, it is a good course and you learn stuff.
results.content_html: Not for absolute beginners. If you don't know what a tag or element is, white space and how to nest elements, then you should search for another course. This course is concise and it is good to polish off the basics of HTML and to move to the next level. It uses online coding environment so you can practise. The audio and video are pretty good apart from the last two lectures where there are some audio problems for a few seconds. Unfortunately, I saw quite a few unanswered questions, posted a long time ago, that is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. Overall, it is a good course and you learn stuff.

results.content: I quite enjoyed the course as I took it as a recap of my HTML knowledge of about  10 years ago. Definitely a introduction course but a very well structured one for anyone interested in starting out in web development. Highly recommended for beginners.
results.content_html: I quite enjoyed the course as I took it as a recap of my HTML knowledge of about 10 years ago. Definitely a introduction course but a very well structured one for anyone interested in starting out in web development. Highly recommended for beginners.

I had no idea what HTML really was but now I have the confidence to continue to learn other programming codes. I thoroughly enjoyed this course.
results.content_html: Each lesson was simple, straight to the point, clear and short which was great. Longer videos would have been overwhelming and these lessons were not overwhelming at all. I had no idea what HTML really was but now I have the confidence to continue to learn other programming codes. I thoroughly enjoyed this course.

results.content: Very good introduction to HTML. Nice snippets with good explanations of  “why” things operate the way they do. The course was delivered at a good pace and in nice "bite sized"  logical chunks.
results.content_html: Very good introduction to HTML. Nice snippets with good explanations of “why” things operate the way they do. The course was delivered at a good pace and in nice "bite sized" logical chunks.

results.content: Sometimes you do not have all the time in the world to explore something, but you want to dip your toes into it anyways. This one hour course did just that for me. Short, but not lacking important information, the course gets you off the starting block and points you to the right direction for further exploration. The educator knows his stuff well enough to cut straight to the point. I am inclined to say this is the best 1 hour on this subject I have ever spent. Keep it up
